events.text: I hate to say it Olivia, but I think the well's run dry on this one for me. This old gumshoe is out of ideas.
I caught a glimpse of something in her eyes. Disappointment, maybe. Well, she'd have to live with it, same as I'd live with my sin.
Is that so? Nothing else catch your eye?
I think this is one for the lab to figure out. Maybe I'll hit the pavement, ask around the city, see if the hit was planned, drum up some leads. But for now, I've got a wife and kid to get back to.
I turned to leave.
Good luck on the case, Olivia. You too, Jesse.
Freedom. Finally.
John...
I cocked my head over my shoulder, casual as could be.
Yeah, Olivia?
Sure there's nothing else?

events.question: Something was off. I could feel it.

events.text: Sorry to let you down, but that's all I can see. I gotta get home.
I turned again, face touching freedom and the misty morning air. Freedom to walk the streets a killer was still freedom.
John.
My stomach dropped. Something was DEFINITELY off. Why did she keep stopping me?
What have you got in your jacket, John?
I froze, for one damning second. Tried to play it cool.
Why? Trying to bum some cash for lunch?
Nobody laughed. Nothing about this was funny.
Stop him. Search him.
I felt all the fight leave me. Damn near fell to the ground right then and there. A cop patted me down, and found the tray. Still with blood on it.
Going somewhere with that, John?
WIFENAME1. Little Billy. Daddy's sorry.
Arrest him.

No. You know what was off?
All of it. All of this. Looking a friend I'd known for years in the eyes and lying with a straight face. Sabotaging a police investigation to save my own hide.
I knew I wasn't a good man. But sometimes when I stared down the criminal scum of Las Borpas, when I looked at the scum of the city, I wondered if maybe I could be a better one.
And you know what I saw, when I turned around, and looked Olivia in the face? She knew. She'd known the whole damn time.
Slowly, head spinning, the world going quiet, I pulled the tray from my jacket. Somewhere behind his sister, Jesse gasped.
I could hear the disappointment in her voice.
Arrest him.
